info.name: Dynatrace Configuration API (200)
info.description:
Documentation of the Dynatrace Configuration API. Refer to the [help page](https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/shortlink/config-api) to read about use-cases and examples.

Notes about compatibility:
* Operations marked as early adopter or preview may be changed in non-compatible ways, although we try to avoid this.
* We may add new enum constants without incrementing the API version; thus, clients need to handle unknown enum constants gracefully.

item.name: alerting Profiles
{id}
Gets the properties of the specified alerting profile | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required alerting profile.

item.name: Updates an existing alerting profile | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the alerting profile to be updated.

request.description: If an alerting profile with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new one is created.

response.name: Success. The new alerting profile has been created. The response contains the ID of the new alerting profile.
Success. The alerting profile has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Deletes the specified alerting profile | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the alerting profile to be deleted.

request.description: The default alerting profile cannot be deleted.

response.name: Success. The alerting profile has been deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the payload the `PUT /alertingProfiles/{id}` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the alerting profile to be validated.

response.name: Validated. The submitted alerting profile is valid. Response doesn't have a body

item.name: Lists all alerting profiles available in your environment | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER
Creates a new alerting profile | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

request.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

response.name: Success. The new alerting profile has been created. The response contains the ID of the new alerting profile.

item.name: Validates the payload the `POST /alertingProfiles` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

response.name: Validated. The submitted alerting profile is valid. Response doesn't have a body

item.name: disk Events
{id}
Gets the properties of the specified disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required disk event rule.

item.name: Updates or creates a disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the disk event rule to be updated.

request.description: If a disk event rule with the specified ID does not exist, a new rule is created.

response.name: Success. The disk event rule has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.
Success. The new disk event rule has been created. The ID of the new disk event rule is returned.
Failed. The specified ID is reserved for internal use.

item.name: Deletes the specified disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the disk event rule to be deleted.

response.name: Success. The disk event rule has been deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `PUT /anomalyDetection/diskEvents/{id}` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the disk event rule to be validated.

response.name: Validated. The submitted disk event rule is valid. Response doesn't have a body.
Failed. The specified ID is reserved for internal use.

item.name: Lists all existing disk event rules | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER
Creates a new disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

request.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

response.name: Success. The new disk event rule has been created. The ID of the new disk event rule is returned.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `POST /anomalyDetection/diskEvents` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

response.name: Validated. The submitted disk event rule is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

Gets the configuration of anomaly detection for hosts
Updates the configuration of anomaly detection for hosts

response.name: Success. Configuration has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: metric Events
{id}
Gets the properties of the specified metric event | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required metric event.

item.name: Updates an existing metric event or creates a new one | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the metric event to be updated.

 If you also set the ID in the body, it must match this ID.

request.description:
If the metric event with the specified ID does not exist, a new metric event will be created. 

 You can't update the **type** of the metric event.

response.name: Success. The new metric event has been created. The response contains the ID of the newly created metric event
Success. The metric event has been updated. The response is empty.

item.name: Deletes the specified metric event | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the metric event to be deleted.

request.description: You can't delete events created by plugins.

response.name: Deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `PUT /anomalyDetection/metricEvents/{id}` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the metric event to be validated.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Lists all configured metric events | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

query.description:
Flag to include metric events with associated entities to the response. 

 Metric events with **entity** filters aren't compatible across environments. If set to `false`, metric events with entity filters will be removed.

item.name: Creates a new metric event | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

request.description: The response contains the ID of the newly created metric event.

response.name: Success. The metric event has been created. The response contains the ID and name of the newly created metric event

item.name: Validates the payload for the `POST /anomalyDetection/metricEvents` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Gets the configuration of the specified web application

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the requested web application.

item.name: Updates the configuration of the specified web application or creates a new one

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the web application to update. 

If you set the ID in the body as well, it must match this ID.

request.description: If the application with the specified ID does not exist, a new application will be created.

response.name: Success. The new configuration has been created. The response body contains the ID and name of the new web application.
Success. Configuration has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Deletes the specified web application

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the web application to delete.

response.name: Success. The application has been deleted. The response does not have a body.

item.name: Validates the configuration of the web application for the `PUT /applications/web/{id}` request.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the web application to validate.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: default
data Privacy
Gets the data privacy settings of the default web application

request.description:
Default application is pre-configured in your Dynatrace environment. By default all the traffic goes to this application. 

After you configure your own applications, all the traffic, which doesn't fit to any of your applications, goes to the default one.

item.name: Updates the data privacy settings of the default web application

request.description:
Default application is pre-configured in your Dynatrace environment. By default all traffic goes to this application. 

After you configure your own applications, all the traffic, which doesn't fit to any of your applications, goes to the default one.

response.name: Success. Data privacy settings have been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates data privacy settings of the default web application for the `PUT /applications/web/default/dataPrivacy` request

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Gets the configuration of the default web application

request.description:
Default application is pre-configured in your Dynatrace environment. By default all traffic goes to this application. 

After you configure your own applications, all the traffic, which doesn't fit to any of your applications, goes to the default one.

item.name: Updates the configuration of the default web application

request.description:
Default application is pre-configured in your Dynatrace environment. By default all traffic goes to this application. 

After you configure your own applications, all the traffic, which doesn't fit to any of your applications, goes to the default one.

response.name: Success. Configuration has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the configuration of the default web application for the `PUT /applications/web/default` request

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

Creates a new web application

response.name: Success. The response body contains the ID and name of the new web application.

item.name: Validates the configuration of the web application for the `POST /applications/web` request

item.name: Lists data privacy settings of all web applications
application Detection Rules
{id}
Gets the parameters of the specified application detection rule

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required application detection rule.

item.name: Updates the specified application detection rule

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the application detection rule to be updated. 

 If you set the ID in the body as well, it must match this ID.

request.description:
If the application detection rule with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new application is created and appended to the end of the rule list. 

If the **order** parameter is set for an existing rule, the request uses this value. Otherwise it keeps the existing order of rules.

response.name: Success. Application detection rule has been created. Response contains the ID of the new rule.
Success. Application detection rule has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Deletes the specified application detection rule

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the application detection rule to be deleted.

response.name: Deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validate the payload for the `PUT /applicationDetection/{id}` request

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the application detection rule to be validated. 

 If you set the ID in the body as well, it must match this ID.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Lists all available application detection rules
Creates a new application detection rule

query.description:
The position of the new rule: 

 * `APPEND`: at the bottom of the rule list. 
 * `PREPEND`: at the top of the rule list. 

 If not set, the `APPEND` is used.

request.description:
The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server. 

You can only create detection rules for an existing application. If you need to create a rule for an application that doesn't exist yet, [create an application first](https://www.dynatrace.com/support/help/shortlink/api-config-web-app-post-web-app) and then configure detection rules for it.

response.name: Success. The application detection rule has been created. Response contains the ID of the new rule.

item.name: Reorders the application detection rules

request.description: This request reorders the application detection rules according to the submitted list of IDs. Application detection rules not present in the body of the request will retain their relative ordering but are placed *after* all those present in the request.

response.name: Success. Application detection rules have been reordered. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `POST /applicationDetection` request

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: auto Tags
{id}
Gets the properties of the specified auto-tag

query.description:
Flag to include process group references to the response. 

 Process group references aren't compatible across environments. 

When this flag is set to `false`, conditions with process group references are removed. If that results in a rule having no conditions, the entire rule is removed.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required auto-tag.

item.name: Updates an existing auto-tag

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the auto-tag to be updated.

 If you set the ID in the body as well, it must match this ID.

request.description: If the auto-tag with the specified ID does not exist, a new auto-tag is created.

response.name: Success. The new auto-tag has been created. The response body contains the ID of the new auto-tag.
Success. The auto-tag has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Deletes the specified auto-tag

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the auto-tag to be deleted.

response.name: Deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `PUT /autoTags/{id}` request

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the auto-tag to be validated.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Lists all configured auto-tags
Creates a new auto-tag

request.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

response.name: Success. The auto-tag has been created. The response body contains the ID of the new auto-tag.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `POST /autoTags` request

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: conditional Naming/{type}
{id}
Lists the parameters of the specified naming rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The type of the rule, defined by the type of Dynatrace entities to which the rule applies.
(Required) The ID of the required naming rule.

item.name: Updates the specified naming rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The type of the rule, defined by the type of Dynatrace entities to which the rule applies.
(Required) The ID of the naming rule to be updated.

request.description: If the rule with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new rule will be created at the end of the rules list and will be the last to evaluate.

response.name: Success. The naming rule has been created. The response contains the ID of the new rule.
Success. The naming rule has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Deletes the specified naming rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The type of the rule, defined by the type of Dynatrace entities to which the rule applies.
(Required) The ID of the naming rule to be deleted.

response.name: Deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `PUT /conditionalNaming/{type}/{id}` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The type of the rule, defined by the type of Dynatrace entities to which the rule applies.
(Required) The ID of the naming rule to be validated.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Lists all configured naming rules of the specified type | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The type of the rule, defined by the type of Dynatrace entities to which the rule applies.

item.name: Creates a new naming rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The type of the rule, defined by the type of Dynatrace entities to which the rule applies.

request.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

response.name: Success. The naming rule has been created. The response contains the ID of the new rule

item.name: Validates the payload for the `POST /conditionalNaming/{type}` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The type of the rule, defined by the type of Dynatrace entities to which the rule applies.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: credentials
{id}
Gets the metadata of the specified credentials set | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The Dynatrace entity ID of the required credentials set.

request.description: The credentials set itself (username/certificate and password) is not included in the response.

response.name: Success. The response contains the metadata of the credentials set.

item.name: Updates the specified credentials set | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The Dynatrace entity ID of the credentials set to be updated.

response.name: Success. The credentials set has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.
Success. The new credentials set has been created. The response contains the ID of the set.

item.name: Deletes the specified credentials set | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the credentials set to be deleted.

response.name: Success. The credentials set has been deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Lists all sets of credentials for synthetic monitors stored in your environment | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

query.description: Filters the result by the specified credentials type.

item.name: Creates a new credentials set | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

request.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

response.name: Success. The new credentials set has been created. The response contains the ID of the set.

item.name: service
custom Services/{technology}
{id}
Gets the definition of the specified custom service

query.description:
Flag to include process group references to the response. 

 Process group references aren't compatible across environments. 

`false` is used if the value is not set.

variable.description: (Required) Technology of the custom service you're inquiring.
(Required) The ID of the custom service you're inquiring.

item.name: Updates the specified custom service or create a new one.

variable.description: (Required) Technology of the custom service to update.

(Required) The ID of the custom service to update.

 The ID of the custom service in the body of the request must match this ID.

request.description: Will use the config's ´order´ attribute if supplied, otherwise keeps the order of the existing config or appends if no existing config with the supplied ID was found.

response.name: Success. Custom service has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.
Success. Custom service has been created. Response contains the new service's ID and name.

item.name: Deletes the specified custom service

variable.description: (Required) Technology of the custom service to delete.
(Required) The ID of the custom service to delete.

response.name: Deleted. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Validate the new custom service for the `PUT /customServices/{technology}/{id}` request

variable.description: (Required) Technology of the custom service to validate.
(Required) The ID of the custom service to validate.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Lists all custom services of the specified technology

variable.description: (Required) Technology of the required custom services.

item.name: Creates a custom service

query.description: Order of the new custom service. Set to `PREPEND` to prepend it to the list, `APPEND` to append it. Defaults to `APPEND`.

variable.description: (Required) Technology of the new custom service.

request.description: In the body of the request, neither custom service nor its rules can have the ID. All IDs will be generated automatically by Dynatrace.

response.name: Success. The custom service has been created. Response contains the new service's ID and name.

item.name: Reorders the custom services of the specified technology

variable.description: (Required) Technology of custom services to update.

request.description: This request reorders the custom services of the specified technology according to the given list of IDs. Custom services not present in the body of the request will retain their relative ordering but will be ordered *after* all those present in the request.

response.name: Success. Custom services have been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validate the new custom service for the `POST /customServices/{technology}` request

variable.description: (Required) Technology of the custom service to validate.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

variable.description:
(Required) The name of the queue manager to be updated. 

 The name of the queue manager in the body of the request must match this name.

request.description: If the queue manager with the specified ID doesn’t exist, a new queue manager will be created.

response.name: Success. The new queue manager has been created. Response contains the name of the queue manager.

item.name: Lists all available queue managers

request.description:
This endpoint is used to provide Dynatrace with your IBM MQ setup regarding alias, remote and cluster queues. 

 This is required to facilitate end to end tracing for messages send via IBM MQ where sender and receiver use different queue names. Without this information Dynatrace would still trace all requests, but would not be able to stitch service calls that use these IBM MQ features.

item.name: ims Entry Queue
{id}
Gets the properties of the specified IBM IMS entry queue

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required IBM IMS entry queue.

item.name: Updates an existing IBM IMS entry queue or creates a new one

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the IBM IMS entry queue to update.

 If you set the ID in the body as well, it must match this ID.

request.description: If the IBM IMS entry queue with the specified ID does not exist, a new IBM IMS entry queue will be created.

response.name: Success. The IBM IMS entry queue has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.
Success. The new IBM IMS entry queue has been created. The response body contains the ID and name of the created IBM IMS entry queue.

item.name: Deletes the specified IBM IMS entry queue

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the IBM IMS entry queue to be deleted.

response.name: Deleted. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Validates update of existing IBM IMS entry queues for the `PUT /service/ibmMQTracing/imsEntryQueue/{id}` request

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the IBM IMS entry queue to validate.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Lists all IBM IMS entry queues

request.description:
This endpoint is used to provide Dynatrace with all IBM MQ queues (defined by QueueManagerName and QueueName) which are used to send messages to IBM IMS on the mainframe. 

 This is required to facilitate end to end tracing for messages sent via IBM MQ to IBM IMS.

item.name: Creates an IBM IMS entry queue

request.description: The body must not provide an ID as it will be automatically assigned by the Dynatrace server.

response.name: Success. The IBM IMS entry queue has been created. The response body contains the generated ID.

item.name: Validates new IBM IMS entry queues for the `POST /service/ibmMQTracing/imsEntryQueue` request

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: request Attributes
{id}
Shows the properties of the specified request attribute

query.description:
Flag to include process group references to the response. 

 Process Group group references aren't compatible across environments.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required request attribute.

item.name: Updates an existing request attribute or creates a new one

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the request attribute to be updated.

 If you set the ID in the body as well, it must match this ID.

response.name: Success. Request attribute has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.
Success. The request attribute with the specified ID has been created. The ID of the new configuration is returned.

item.name: Deletes the specified request attribute

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the request attribute to be deleted.

response.name: Deleted. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Validate updates of existing request attribute for the `PUT /requestAttributes/{id}` request

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the request attribute to be validated.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Lists all available request attributes
Creates a new request attribute

request.description: The body must not provide an ID as IDs are automatically assigned.

response.name: Success. Request attribute has been created. The ID of the new configuration is returned.

item.name: Validates new request attributes for the `POST /requestAttributes` request

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: request Naming
{id}
Gets the parameters of the specified request naming rule

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the request naming rule you're inquiring.

item.name: Updates the specified request naming rule

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the request naming to be updated.

 The ID of the request naming in the body of the request must match this ID.

request.description: If the rule with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new rule will be created at the end of the rules list and will be the last to evaluate.

response.name: Success. Request naming rule has been created. Response contains the new request naming rule's ID and name.
Success. Request naming rule has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Deletes the specified request naming rule

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the request naming rule to be deleted.

response.name: Success. The rule has been deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the new request naming for the `PUT /requestNaming/{id}` request

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the request naming to be updated.

 The ID of the request naming in the body of the request must match this ID.

request.description: If the rule with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new rule will be created at the end of the rules list and will be the last to evaluate.

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: Lists all request naming rules along with their parameters
Creates a new request naming rule

query.description: Order of the new request naming rule. Set to `PREPEND` to prepend it to the list, `APPEND` to append it. Defaults to `APPEND`.

request.description: The new rule goes to the end of the rules list and will be the last to evaluate. Existing rules remain unaffected.

response.name: Success. The request naming has been created. Response contains the new service's ID.

item.name: Reorders the request namings

request.description: This request reorders the request namings according to the given list of IDs. Request namings not present in the body of the request will retain their relative ordering but will be ordered *after* all those present in the request.

response.name: Success. Request namings have been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the new request naming rule for the `POST /requestNaming` request

response.name: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

Lists the global service resource requests.

request.description: Lists all extensions which currently are renamed to e.g., `Image`

item.name: Updates the global service resource requests.

request.description: Update all extensions which are renamed to `Image` or `Binary`

response.name: Success. The configuration is updated. Response does not have a body.
Failed. The input is invalid. See the response body for details.

item.name: Validates new resource requests settings for the `PUT /service/resourceRequest` request.

response.name: Failed. The input is invalid. See the response body for details.
Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response does not have a body.

item.name: detection Rules
FULL WEB REQUEST
{id}
Gets the properties of the specified service detection rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required service detection rule.

response.name: Success. The response contains properties of the specified rule.
Failed. The rule with the specified ID doesn't exist.

item.name: Updates an existing service detection rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the rule to be updated.

request.description:
If a rule with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new rule is created and appended to the end of the rule list. 

 The request keeps the existing order of rules, unless the **order** parameter is set.

response.name: Success. The service detection rule has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.
Success. The new service detection rule has been created. The response body contains the ID of the rule.

item.name: Deletes the specified service detection rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the service detection rule to be deleted.

response.name: Failed. The rule with the specified ID doesn't exist.
Deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Validates the payload for the `PUT /service/detectionRules/FULL_WEB_REQUEST/{id}` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the service detection rule to be validated.

response.name: Validated. The service detection rule is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

item.name: Lists all full web service detection rules | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

response.name: Success. The response contains the ordered list of rules.

item.name: Creates a new service detection rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

query.description:
The position of the new rule: 

 * `APPEND`: at the bottom of the rule list. 
 * `PREPEND`: at the top of the rule list. 

 If not set, the `APPEND` is used.

request.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

response.name: Success. The new service detection rule has been created. The response body contains the ID of the rule.

item.name: Reorders the service detection rules of the specified type | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

request.description:
